title: Sights and scenes in Europe :
author: Stevenson, William.
snippet: Returning to Mullingar, I passed on my way to Belfast, stopping at most of them, Cavan, Clones, Monaghan, Armagh, Portadown, Lurgan, Moira and Lisburn.

title: Travels in lands beyond the sea.
author: Linskill, Charles Dorrance.
snippet: Our train halts at Lisburn, and, going on, we pass through Moira, Lurgan, Portadown and Scarva.

title: A year in Europe.
author: Griscom, John
snippet: 1 dined and lodged at the house of a friend, J. C******, about five miles from Lurgan, whose residence  is one of the neatest and most pleasant rural spots I have any where visited.

title: A year in Europe.
author: Griscom, John
snippet: Lurgan is probably one of the most respectable villages, for its size, in the island ; and yet there were

title: A year in Europe.
author: Griscom, John
snippet: Lurgan is a market town, and I had an opportunity this morning of witnessing the bustle of an Irish country market.

title: A year in Europe.
author: Griscom, John
snippet: At Lurgan I was introduced to a family of Friends, consisting of the father and mother, and fourteen children, seven sons and seven daughters.

title: A year in Europe.
author: Griscom, John
snippet: An intelligent friend, J. R*********, at whose house I was kindly entertained last night, brought me this morning in his jaunting car to Lurgan, a town about a mile from the south end of Lough Neagh.

title: Notes of foreign travel.
author: Bates, James Hale
snippet: with bloody slaughter, on through Dunkald and Lurgan and many another historic town ; for all these towns and hamlets have traditions and records going back for centuries.

title: Travels in Lands beyond the Sea. Beauty and Glory of Western Europe, etc
